channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A tale of two U.S. interventions and why Venezuela is not Panama 2.0
item.description: Operation Absolute Resolve, that resulted in the capture of Nicolás Maduro, echoes the 1990 U.S. invasion of Panama that brought down Manuel Noriega. ...

item.title: Who is María Corina Machado, Venezuela's Nobel Peace Prize winning opposition leader?
item.description: The United States has captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. Opposition leader María Corina Machado has been one of his biggest critics.

item.title: Venezuelans wonder who's in charge as Trump claims contact with Maduro's deputy
item.description: Venezuelans scrambled to understand who was in charge of their country after the U.S. captured Nicolás Maduro. President Trump offered an answer: The ...

item.title: Trump tried to bury evidence of the Jan. 6 riot. NPR's archive preserves the facts
item.description: NPR's Jan. 6 archive brings together reporting, video, documents and testimony to show what really happened during the Capitol riot. Explore the timel...

item.title: Trump wants U.S. oil companies in Venezuela. Here's what to know
item.description: President Trump wants more U.S. oil companies to "go in" to Venezuela. But there are economic, historical, and climate reasons that may not be easy. H...

item.title: U.S. lawmakers react after Trump announces Venezuela operation
item.description: Reactions from U.S. lawmakers poured in after the Trump administration announced strikes on Venezuela and the capture of the country's president.

item.title: "48 Hours" show schedule
item.description: True crime. Real justice. To miss it would be a crime.

item.title: World reaction to U.S. strikes on Venezuela pours in
item.description: Many U.S. adversaries condemned the U.S. strikes on Venezuela, while other governments called for deescalation.

item.title: U.S. captures Maduro after strikes; Trump says "we're going to run the country" for now
item.description: After the U.S. carried out an attack inside Venezuela, Trump said Maduro was captured and flown out, and the U.S. would "run" Venezuela for now.

item.title: Police identify 16 more victims of Swiss bar fire
item.description: A criminal investigation has been launched into the fire, with families now facing an agonising wait to identify missing loved ones.

item.title: Wicked composer latest to cancel Kennedy Center gig after Trump name change
item.description: Stephen Schwartz says he will not appear at the arts venue as it "has now become an ideological statement".

item.title: Who's in charge of Venezuela and what happens next?
item.description: Donald Trump says the US will "run" Venezuela until a "safe" transition after capturing its president and first lady.

item.title: Woman says tea laced with pills given to ex was a chemistry experiment
item.description: Esther Jane Stephen, a high school softball coach, was arrested in 2020 in the fatal shooting of her former fiancé Shea Briar in Jay County, Indiana. ...

item.title: Trump says US will 'run' Venezuela and 'fix oil infrastructure'
item.description: The US launched strikes on Venezuela on Saturday in which Maduro and his wife were captured by US forces.

item.title: Brigitte Bardot Foundation issues warning about scam memorabilia
item.description: Online adverts tout merchandise of the actress with claims the proceeds will go to her charity, it says.

item.title: Maduro’s ouster sparks celebrations among Venezuelans in South Florida

item.title: US plans to ‘run’ Venezuela and tap its oil reserves, Trump says, after operation to oust Maduro
